body:
# maxLamp
app controled RGB led matrix. node + express + socket.io + johnny-five

## what's in ?
- individual or global color picker that changes the RGB neopixel matrix on the fly
- pomodoro feature

## how does it work ?
a matrix of 5x8 individually addressable rgb leds are controlled by a web app.
- an 8x5 led matrix is plugged on a arduino Uno flashed with Firmata firmware.
- the arduino board is connected to the raspi with a usb cable (data communication only)
(important : arduino should have is own power supply, DO NOT rely on the raspi to do that, it works till a certain amount of led brightness)
- a raspberry pi hosts the app running node.js and express
- the serial port connection is handled by johnny-five (using npm serialport)
- real time data communication is handled by socket.io


see Adafruit's page on NeoPixel leds
https://learn.adafruit.com/adafruit-neopixel-uberguide/


## to do :
- enable user to create its own color pattern 
- create notifications (twitter, fb, motion detected on a camera) and associate color patterns to notifications
